meanings.definition: The action of placing one thing on top of another.
meanings.sent1: She carefully made superpositions of the books on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The superpositions of the plates on the table made it look neat.
meanings.sent3: In a playful mood, he created superpositions of his toys on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her superpositions of colors in the painting created a beautiful harmony.
meanings.sent5: The superpositions of flavors in the cake made it delicious.

meanings.definition: The state of being simultaneously in multiple states or positions.
meanings.sent1: The superpositions of the cat on the fence amazed the children.
meanings.sent2: His superpositions of thoughts made it hard for him to focus.
meanings.sent3: The superpositions of the actors on stage confused the audience.
meanings.sent4: The superpositions of emotions in her heart were overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: The superpositions of colors in the sky during sunset were breathtaking.
